snippet: The shift in the investigation came shortly after officials said the female suspect in the shooting had pledged allegiance to the Islamic State in a Facebook posting.
abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation announces that it is now treating shooting massacre in San Bernadino, Calif, as act of terrorism; pivotal shift in investigation appears to be discovery of Facebook post by female suspect Tashfeen Malik, in which she pledges her allegiance to Islamic State.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA
byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt reported from Washington, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Reporting was contributed by Julie Turkewitz, Ian Lovett and Rick Rojas from San Bernardino, Calif.; Eric Schmitt and Mark Mazzetti from Washington; Rukmini Callimachi, Julia Preston, Mike McIntire, John Corrales and Alan Schwarz from New York; Waqar Gillani from Lahore, Pakistan; Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan; and C. J. Chivers.

lead_paragraph: The shift in the investigation came shortly after officials said the female suspect in the shooting had pledged allegiance to the Islamic State in a Facebook posting.

headline.main: F.B.I. Treating San Bernardino Attack as Terrorism Case
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Is Treating Rampage as Act of Terrorism
